item.title: Harry G. Frankfurt’s ‘On Bullshit,’ and the Epistemic Standards of Philosophy
item.description: Ever wake up in the morning having an imaginary intellectual argument with an imaginary person in which you are definitely right? This is a very literal version of ‘phantom opinions’ and it happens to me all the time. Most of my greatest intellectual successes occur in this world. I am astonishingly convincing. Let’s test one of them here to see if it actually works, though. So. Philosophy sometimes takes a battering from the scientific/rationalist/new-atheist crowd for, essentially, not being science.
